answers.answer: HiSome of the causes of increased frequency of urination (with/without pain) are:•	Infection: Bladder, prostrate or any where along the urinary tract•	Medical Conditions : Diabetes etc•	Stones : Bladder, prostrate or any where along the urinary tract•	Medications : diuretics (water pills)•	Organ diseases (including tumors): bladder, kidney etc•	Psychological: Stress, anxietyYou should consult a urologist for a complete evaluation including tests such as urine examination, scans, blood tests etc.Take care and do write in if you need more information.Regards

question: I'm a 24-year old male.  For the last 2 or 3 weeks, I've been needing to pee a lot more often than normal.  I probably go about 10 times daily now.  I wake up 3 or 4 times every night to go.  When I go, I can hardly get anything out and I have to strain a lot (not very painful, but some). Sometimes, I need to go again about 10 minutes after I went.I had hypospadias repaired as an infant and I haven't had any problems at all.I moved from the United States to Poland about a month ago, but I also lived in Poland from 2003-2005 with no such problems.No idea what's going on.  Any help?
title: Need to pee often and it hurts
